*div1 type="summary"* *p*Asa Mitchell to Austin, June 18, 1826. Commerce. Manufacture of salt.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Mouth of Brassos*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="06-18-1826">18th June 1826*/date_mentioned* */p**p*Dear sir—*/p*
*p*As this leaves me so may it find you enjoying the blessing of good health—I have been much disappointed in my expectations at *location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned* in consequence of *person_mentioned*Jesse Thompson*/person_mentioned* not meeting me there agreeable to contract I advanced him money to pay for his *location_mentioned*lands*/location_mentioned* before he left this and he was to let me have the cash in *location_mentioned*Orleans*/location_mentioned* with which I calculated to buy a set of salt kettles—the vessel also being in debt more than I expected it was seized and sold and I was not able to releave it but waited from day to day for *person_mentioned*Thompson*/person_mentioned* to come on and let me have money but to my great mortification he never arive[d] an old acquaintance of mine bought the sloop and let us have it to get *location_mentioned*home*/location_mentioned* */p* *p**person_mentioned*Asa Mitchell*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*NB I have bought a good supply of sugar coffee and other articles in the provision line to acomodate those who would wish to visit the *location_mentioned*sea shore*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Col. Stephen. F. Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San Philipe. De. Austin Texas*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
